content.text:
# Draft:Zack Wardlaw

Zachariah Wardlaw Jr. (December 22, 1844-?) was a farmer, mercantilist, and state legislator in Mississippi. He represented Hinds County in the Mississippi House of Representatives. he also served on the county school board and as an alderman in Utica. He was part of an effort to erect a Jefferson Davis statue at the Vicksburg Military Park.
He had Scotish ancestors. He served in the Confederate Army.
Dolbair's Commercial College in New Orleans. Married and has two daughters. His namesake som died in 1919.
Walter Pate was born in Airmount in 1874.
